name: Grilled Corn Salad Recipe With Zucchini And Feta
description: This Grilled Zucchini and Corn Salad is our newest veggie obsession! It is absolutely packed with flavor from a homemade basil vinaigrette, toasted walnuts, and feta cheese. You will want to serve this all summer long, no matter the occasion! Gluten-free.

recipe_ingredient.note: 2-3 zucchini (ends trimmed, cut into quartered wedges)
recipe_ingredient.display: 2-3 zucchini (ends trimmed, cut into quartered wedges)

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 Tbsp avocado oil (or other light, neutral oil)
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 Tbsp avocado oil (or other light, neutral oil)

recipe_ingredient.note: ¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
recipe_ingredient.display: ¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper

recipe_ingredient.note: ¼ - ½ cup basil vinaigrette ( or other light vinaigrette)
recipe_ingredient.display: ¼ - ½ cup basil vinaigrette ( or other light vinaigrette)

recipe_instructions.text: Season the zucchini. Place quartered zucchini wedges in a large mixing bowl, then drizzle with 2 Tbsp avocado oil, ¾ tsp Kosher salt, and ¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper. Toss to thoroughly coat.

Grill the corn and zucchini. Preheat a grill to medium-high. When hot, coat with nonstick grill spray. Place shucked corn and seasoned zucchini wedges directly on grill grates, then cook for 3-4 minutes per side, about 12-14 minutes, or until the corn is charred on all sides and the zucchini is tender and has almost a creamy texture.

Cut the veggies. Allow the corn and zucchini to cool for about 5 minutes, then use a sharp knife to cut the kernels off of each ear of corn. Slice the zucchini into ½" pieces. Place in a large mixing bowl.

Assemble the salad. To the zucchini and corn, add ⅓ cup crumbled feta, ⅓ cup chopped toasted walnuts, and ¼ cup thinly sliced scallions. Drizzle with ¼ cup of basil vinaigrette (or whichever dressing you're using), then toss to thoroughly coat. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve immediately or at room temperature with a generous pinch of flaky sea salt. Feel free to top with additional feta, walnuts, or scallions!
